title: Bug 45145: Second window comes to front when using first
description: When using two Eclipse windows and switching from another application to one Eclipse window, clicking on a docked view or perspective causes the other window to come to the front, covering the windows of other applications.
OB: When switching from another application to one Eclipse window and clicking on a docked view or perspective, the other Eclipse window comes to the front, covering the windows of other applications
EB: When switching from another application to one Eclipse window and clicking on a docked view or perspective, the other Eclipse window should remain in the background and not cover the windows of other applications
SR: Ensure that when switching from another application to one Eclipse window and clicking on a docked view or perspective, the other Eclipse window does not come to the front and covers the windows of other applications
